did.abstract: Correspondence relating to politics and his activities as regent of the University of Michigan; also material concerning the depression and impact of the New Deal on agriculture in Michigan.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection came to the library from Jacob Shoemaker and John Huizenga (donor no. 4032) in 1963.

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright had not been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Benjamin Sawtell Hanchett Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Benjamin Sawtell Hanchett was a Grand Rapids, Michigan, farmer, businessman, and regent of University of Michigan, 1911-1929. Hanchett was born in Grand Rapids, October 1, 1868. After completing his education in the public schools of that city he began working for the Street Railway company of Grand Rapids as an office boy. He remained with the company, later know n as the Grand Rapids Traction Company, his entire career, rising to the office of president and general manager. In 1900-1901 he built the Grand Rapids, Holland and Lake Michigan Railway which was the first interurban railroad in western Michigan and served as president of the company for a time. Hanchett served three successive terms as mayor of the village of East Grand Rapids.

Hanchett was appointed t the University of Michigan Board of Regents in April 1911 to complete the term of Loyal E. Knappen of Grand Rapids who had resigned. He was elected in his own right in1912 and served until resigning in 1929.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence relating to politics and his activities as regent of the University of Michigan; also material concerning the depression and impact of the New Deal on agriculture in Michigan.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Agriculture--Michigan.
Depressions--1929--Michigan.
Farmers--Michigan--Grand Rapids.
New Deal, 1933-1939--Michigan.
Railroads--Michigan.
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan. Board of Regents.

did.unittitle: Market Administration, National Recovery Administration, etc.
War Food Administration, Commodity Price Corporation
Code Authority, Wheat Flour Milling Industry
Indentures, and miscellaneous legal and financial materials
Letterbooks containing copies of letters to employees (of Grand Rapids Railway Co.), other business communications, etc., 1892-1895
Letterbook containing copies of letters (mainly non-business), 1893-1897

list.item: Letter, Nov. 3, 1924, from Hanchett to Coolidge concerning Marion L. Burton; also letter of James B. Reynolds concerning Coolidge, Jan. 23, 1920
Letter from Howard C. Lawrence concerning the nomination of Green for Michigan governor, July 6, 1928.
Letters to Florence and Warren G. Harding, June 23, Nov. 4, 1920, Aug. 2, 1923.

Also letters about Harding: Lewis C. Laylin letter, Feb. 25, 1920, George B. Christian letters, Nov. 4, 1920, Nov. 11, 1921, April 9, Apr. 25 and Aug. 2, 1923; Will H. Hays letter, July 10, 1920; John W. Weeks letter, June 23, 1920
Letter from Hays re Warren G. Harding, July 10, 1920
Feb. 25, Feb. 26, Mar. 2, Mar. 7, Mar. 21, Oct. 19, Nov. 3, 1925;
Jan. 9, Jan. 16, Jan 20, June 3, June 24, June 28, June 30, Oct. 18, Dec. 25, 1922;
Letter from Edward C. Lawrence re the office of president, Feb. 25, 1925
Letter re Warren G. Harding, June 23, 1920
